data.title: How to access past articles from the Guardian and Observer archive
data.meta_description: More than 200 years of archive available to view
data.text:
Since 1791, the worldâ€™s major events have been documented in the pages of the Observer, and from 1821, the Guardian. Today, that record of history is available to view from a number of sources.

Digital Archives

Digital reproductions of every page, article and advertisement published in the Guardian from 1821-2003 and in the Observer from 1791-2003 can be viewed online via the subscription service, newspapers.com.

Members of the British Library can access the professional version of the archive via ProQuest in the reading rooms at St Pancras, London, while many school, university and public libraries also have a subscription.

The Observer Magazine is not included in the digital archive for the years 1964-1993. Issues for these years are held in hardcopy by the British Library and other libraries of deposit.

theguardian.com

Content that appeared in the Guardian and Observer print editions and online since September 1998 is available on theguardian.com. Most articles are included, apart from a few which have been removed for copyright reasons (eg a book serialisation). This content is not formatted in the same way as in the print editions of the newspaper and headlines or images may vary.

Back issues of the Guardian and Observer

For a comprehensive range of original editions dating back to 1900 go to Historic Newspapers.

It may also be possible to access printed back issues at the British Library, the other national libraries of deposit or some local libraries.

From the Guardian archive series

We publish a daily selection of historical articles from the Guardian archive. See also From the Observer archive.

Microfilm and indexes

All articles from the Guardian and Observer are available on microfilm. Some larger libraries hold these and complete sets are available at the British Library Newsroom. A subject index to the Guardian was produced annually from 1842 to 1985, and a subject index to the Observer has been created since 1991. Both have been microfilmed and are available at larger libraries and the British Library.

Anthologies

Many anthologies of articles from the Guardian and the Observer have been produced over the years. Since 1952 the Guardian has published the annual Bedside Guardian/The Guardian Year, while The Observer Observed (1991) is a collection of articles from 1791 to 1990.

The Guardian News and Media Archive
